title: INSTALLATION OF ELECTRIC CABLES OR LINES, OR OF COMBINED OPTICAL AND ELECTRIC CABLES OR LINES  (distribution points incorporating switches H02B; guiding telephone cords H04M1/15; cable ducts or mountings for telephone or telegraph exchange installations H04Q1/06)
glossary_of_terms: "electric cable" includes cables comprising optical conductors, e.g. fibres, in combination with electrical conductors
definition_statement: This place covers: Installation of communication cables or lines, including those comprising a combination of optical and electrical conductors, or of lightning conductors as well as installation of power cables or lines.

title: Methods or apparatus specially adapted for installing, maintaining, repairing or dismantling electric cables or lines
definition_statement: This place covers: Installation planning Tools for preparing walls, floor and ceilings, e.g. drilling tools Templates for positioning electrical boxes Laying cables Removing insulation from cables Joining or terminating cables

title: for overhead lines or cables
informative_references: Cleaning of insulatorsEarthing sticks for live working
definition_statement: This place covers: Planning of high voltage electrical networks Maintenance and repair of overhead lines Apparatus for workers, e.g. robots or carriages travelling along the lines Specialized vehicles Cleaning of electrical lines

title: for mounting or stretching  (wire stretchers in general B25B25/00)
informative_references: Wire stretchers in generalInstallation of trolley lines,
definition_statement: This place covers: Ground vehicles or Helicopter stringing Methods for stringing Devices temporarily fixed to pole for stringing lines

title: for laying cables, e.g. laying apparatus on vehicle  (combined with trench digging or back-filling machines or dredgers E02F5/00)
informative_references: Trench digging or back-filling machines or dredgers
definition_statement: This place covers: The process of laying cables.

title: through tubing or conduit, e.g. rod or draw wire for pushing or pulling {(inserting electrical cables into tubes using wallbores E21B17/206; for optical cables G02B6/4401)}
definition_statement: This place covers: Not only inserting wires into conduits, but also removing wires from conduit where conduit stays intact.

title: for removing insulation or armouring from cables, e.g. from the end thereof  (pliers in general B25B; cutters in general B26B)
informative_references: Pliers in generalCutters in general

title: {the cutting element not rotating about the wire or cable  (making longitudinal and transverse or helical cut H02G1/1229)}
{the cutting element rotating about the wire or cable  (making longitudinal and transverse or helical cut H02G1/1229)}
{the cutting element not rotating about the wire or cable  (making longitudinal and transverse or helical cut H02G1/1268)}
{the cutting element rotating about the wire or cable  (making longitudinal and transverse or helical cut H02G1/1268)}
for joining or terminating cables  (joining electric conductors H01R43/00)
definition_statement: This place covers: The process of joining (end-to end) or bundling (side-by-side) or terminating cables

title: Installations of electric cables or lines in or on buildings, equivalent structures or vehicles  (installations of bus-bars H02G5/00; overhead installations H02G7/00; installations in or on the ground H02G9/00; channels or vertical ducts for receiving utility lines E04F17/08; wiring of electric apparatus in general H05K)
informative_references: Supports for pipes, cables or protective tubing, specially adapted for supporting the pipes all along their length, e.g. pipe channels or ductsWiring of electric apparatus in general
definition_statement: This place covers: Complete wiring of buildings or rooms Pre-wired installation Wirings for modular walls

title: Details
informative_references: Labels
definition_statement: This place covers: Marking or labelling of cable channels

title: Protective tubings or conduits {or channels or other supports} (pipes or tubings in general F16L)
informative_references: Pipes or tubings in general

title: {Details thereof  (installation or suspension of conduit channels and other supports H02G3/263)}
definition_statement: This place covers: Manufacture of cable channels End pieces Dividers inside channels

title: {Heat or fire protective means  (for fire in electric circuits A62C3/16)}
informative_references: For fire in electric circuitsFor tubing in general
glossary_of_terms: IntumescentMaterial expanding in case of fire or heat to fill air gaps
definition_statement: This place covers: Protection for fire coming from outside or inside. Use of intumescent materials

title: {Covers or lids; Their fastenings}
definition_statement: This place covers: Covers or lids only for cable channels, not for electrical boxes, housing or enclosures.

title: {Plinths  (borders for use between floor or ceiling and wall E04F19/04)}
informative_references: Borders for use between floor or ceiling and wall

title: {Channels}
informative_references: Pipe channels or ducts
definition_statement: This place covers: Non circular channels or raceways or wire harness fully enclosing the cables

title: {provided with perforations or slots permitting introduction or exit of wires}
definition_statement: This place covers: Raceways or conduits or wire harness having side exits for cables, e.g. breakable parts.

title: {Ladders or other supports}
informative_references: For pipes or ducts in general
definition_statement: This place covers: Open supports for cables or wire harness

title: {Tubings, i.e. having a closed section}
informative_references: Pipes placed side by side in contact with each other
definition_statement: This place covers: Single piece channels

title: {Corrugated}
definition_statement: This place covers: Tubings having radial ondulations

title: {formed by a succession of articulated units}
{with a circular cross-section  (H02G3/0468, H02G3/0475 take precedence)}
{with a non-circular cross-section  (H02G3/0468, H02G3/0475 take precedence)}
{Service poles}
informative_references: Medical bed nursing arrangements
definition_statement: This place covers: Vertical ducts

title: Joints for connecting lengths of protective tubing {or channels}, to each other or to casings, e.g. to distribution boxes; Ensuring electrical continuity in the joint
informative_references: Connecting general pipes to walls
definition_statement: This place covers: Only cylindrical conduits joint

title: {with means biting into the conductor-insulation, e.g. teeth-like elements or gripping fingers  (H02G3/0675, H02G3/0683 take precedence)}
{with means constricting the conductor-insulation  (H02G3/065, H02G3/0675, H02G3/0683 take precedence)}
{with means clamping the armour of the conductor  (H02G3/0675, H02G3/0683 take precedence)}
{with bolts operating in a direction parallel to the conductors}
{with bolts operating in a direction transverse to the conductors}

definition_statement: This place covers: Connection of corrugated tubings

title: Distribution boxes; Connection or junction boxes  (cable terminations H02G15/02)
{Bases, casings or covers}
definition_statement: This place covers: Constructional details of boxes, housings and enclosures

title: {Inlets}
definition_statement: This place covers: Cable entry into electrical box, housings and enclosures Through holes or openings Grommets

title: {including knock-out or tear-out sections}
definition_statement: This place covers: The cable entry is closed before use by a removable part

title: {Assembled boxes}
definition_statement: This place covers: Connection of two boxes, housings and enclosures or part of boxes in order to increase inner volume

title: {Dustproof, splashproof, drip-proof, waterproof, or flameproof casings or inlets}
definition_statement: This place covers: Fire or heat protection of boxes, housings and enclosures Sound protection Water ingress protection, e.g. with rubber joint Evacuation of water from inside of box, housings and enclosures

title: {in association with a plinth, channel, raceway or similar}
definition_statement: This place covers: Mounting of boxes, housings and enclosures on raceway or at a distance of raceway

title: for flush mounting
informative_references: Pre establishment of boxes in concrete,
definition_statement: This place covers: Boxes, housings and enclosures mounted inside walls

title: {in plain walls}
definition_statement: This place covers: Boxes, housings and enclosures are covered by wall material on sides and bottom

title: {in thin walls}
definition_statement: This place covers: Boxes, housings and enclosures are inserted and fixed into a hole in dry walls

title: {with supporting bar extending between two separate studs of a wall frame}
definition_statement: This place covers: Boxes, housings and enclosures mounted between two studs behind dry wall or ceiling panels

title: {with supporting means for mounting on a single wall stud}
definition_statement: This place covers: Boxes, housings and enclosures mounted on one stud behind dry wall or ceiling panels Boxes, housings and enclosures comprising nail or screw passage

title: {in plinths, channels, raceways or similar}
definition_statement: This place covers: Flush mounted boxes, housings and enclosures into raceways

title: structurally associated with support for line-connecting terminals within the box  (terminals H01R9/00)
definition_statement: This place covers: Provisions inside the boxes, housings and enclosures for cable connecting

title: providing line outlets
definition_statement: This place covers: Fastening of apparatus into electrical boxes, housings and enclosures

Ceiling roses {or other lighting sets}

informative_references: Pipes, cables or protective tubing passing through wallsLead-in or lead-through insulatorsIinsulating tubes or sleeves

informative_references: Insulators in general

title: {Installations of cables, lines, or separate protective tubing therefor directly on or in walls, ceilings, or floors  (by means of insulators H02G3/24; supports for pipes, cables or protective tubing F16L3/00; hose-clips F16L33/02)}

definition_statement: This place covers: Mounting of cable conduits

informative_references: Construction of modular floors

title: {in modular walls, e.g. wall panels}
Installations of bus-bars
informative_references: Flat insulated conductorsBusbar connections in ac/dc convertionPrinted high current conductorsWiring on insulating boards
definition_statement: This place covers: Installation of flat, laminated or tubular non-insulated busbars, mostly for high current/voltage applications. Medium to very high voltage, gas-insulated tubular busbars arranged in a metallic casing.

title: Partially-enclosed installations, e.g. in ducts and adapted for sliding or rolling current collection  (non-rotary current collectors H01R41/00)
informative_references: Non-rotary current collectors

title: Overhead installations of electric lines or cables  (installations of bus-bars H02G5/00; trolley wires or contact lines for electric railways B60M; fastening conductors to insulators H01B17/00, e.g. H01B17/06, H01B17/16, H01B17/22; protection against abnormal electric conditions H01H; hook contacts for temporary connections to overhead lines H01R11/14)
informative_references: Trolley wires or contact lines for electric railwaysFastening conductors to insulatorsProtection against abnormal electric conditionsHook contacts for temporary connections to overhead lines
definition_statement: This place covers: Installation of field power lines Fastening to masts and poles Warning devices Birds or rodents deterring means

title: Devices for adjusting or maintaining mechanical tension, e.g. take-up device
informative_references: Arrangements for supporting or suspending trolley wires
definition_statement: This place covers: Weight or spring activated means pulling on the cables

title: Arrangements or devices for relieving mechanical tension
informative_references: Arrangements for supporting or suspending trolley wires
definition_statement: This place covers: Means releasing the cables in case of mechanical overload

title: Suspension arrangements or devices for electric cables or lines
definition_statement: This place covers: End or middle fastening of cables along poles

definition_statement: This place covers: Fastening of cables directly between two poles,

title: {Dead-end clamps}
definition_statement: This place covers: Fastening of cables ends to poles.

title: Suspensions for lines or cables along a separate supporting wire, e.g. S-hook
definition_statement: This place covers: A separate mechanical wire is used as parallel supporting device

title: Members clamped to the supporting wire or to the line or cable
definition_statement: This place covers: One side of the supporting means acts as a clamp

title: Flexible members or lashings wrapped around both the supporting wire and the line or cable
definition_statement: This place covers: Bands or wire loops,

title: Devices for maintaining distance between parallel conductors, e.g. spacer
definition_statement: This place covers: Rigid devices with a given length are fixed between two lines

title: {Damping spacers}
definition_statement: This place covers: Device with variable length fixed between two line

title: Arrangements or devices for damping mechanical oscillations of lines, e.g. for reducing production of sound {(damping spacers H02G7/125)}
definition_statement: This place covers: Weights or dynamic devices added to lines

title: Devices for removing snow or ice from lines or cables  (from insulators H01B17/52)
definition_statement: This place covers: Mechanical or electrical devices, eventually using transported electricity

title: Devices affording mechanical protection in the event of breakage of a line or cable, e.g. net for catching broken lines
definition_statement: This place covers: Device placed under the lines for receiving broken lines

title: Spatial arrangements or dispositions of lines or cables on poles, posts, or towers  (construction of poles, posts or towers E04H12/22)
definition_statement: This place covers: Crossarms Spacial disposition of parallel lines

informative_references: Cathodic protectionInstallations of optical cables in or on the ground or water

informative_references: Tubings for conductorsStoring means for coiled material specially adapted for repeatedly paying-out and re-storing length of material for particular purposes

definition_statement: This place covers: Apparatus where part of the cable is stored on a reel or similar while power is supplied to the apparatus

informative_references: Indicating, counting or recording lightning strokes
